snippet: At her federal trial in Brooklyn, Cecilia Chang, who led the  Asian Studies Institute at St. John’s University, acknowledged many of the acts she is accused of.
abstract: Cecilia Chang, a former dean of St John’s University accused of using foreign scholarship students as her personal servants and stealing more than $1 million from the school, takes the stand in her own defense; Chang struggles to make her case, with prosecutors limiting her efforts to offer excuses to yes or no answers that sometimes seemed only to implicate her further.
lead_paragraph: At her federal trial in Brooklyn, Cecilia Chang, who led the  Asian Studies Institute at St. John’s University, acknowledged many of the acts she is accused of.

headline.seo: Cecilia Chang, Former Dean, Denies She Stole From St. John’s
headline.main: Ex-Dean Denies She Stole From St. John’s
headline.print_headline: Ex-Dean Denies She Stole From St. John’s
